intro: Pilosella bryhnii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Pilosella bryhnii is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, sunny environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
